duties_responsibilities.duty: Perform individualized nursing care for patients and their families under the direction of an RN.
Collect assessment data using observation, palpation, and auscultation per department guidelines, including age and cultural specific considerations.
Communicate and coordinate with other healthcare team members to ensure patient care activities and workflow.
Document patient and family care needs through documentation per department/entity guideline of care and policies and procedures.
Implement the plan of care per department guidelines and seek out resources when appropriate in new situations.
Give constructive feedback to peers regarding work performance and notify supervisor of suspected performance issues.
Encourage patient and family participation in decision making and act to uphold individual/family rights.
Identify learning needs and barriers/readiness, and collaborate with the RN in the development of an individualized teaching plan.
Demonstrate understanding of patient/family goals and make recommendations to the multidisciplinary team in the development of the patient's plan of care.
Support evaluation of patient/family response to care, contribute observations and data to patient care conferences, and document patients' response to care.

education_certification.credential: 1 year LVN experience in an acute care setting or related area
